climbs.name: North Face Direct
climbs.fa: Steve Larson? from the rail, Jerry Handren  sit start from the low left crimp, '93

content.description: The most aesthetic boulder problem in the area. This starts matched on the obvious crimp rail, five feet off the ground. Make a hard pull to a sloper on the groove. Set a heel below your hand and start working your way up and left until you can move into the jug at half way. Take a brief rest and finish the technical top out. Super classic, on bullet proof granite. The boulder conveniently has a bolt on top to work out the second half.Â
content.protection: Flat landing, but highball. Three pads, and a spotter.
content.location: North face of the Citadel boulder

content.description: The big beautiful boulder that looks like the Matterhorn. Located beneath the left end of the slabs. The name comes from the NEClimbs route database.
